Title: Lagos Assembly passes University of Medicine bill into law
Summary: Lagos State House of Assembly has successfully passed into law the ‘University of Medicine and Health Sciences Bill’ as it completed its third reading on Thursday, 20 November 2025 . This landmark law is a crucial step aimed at strengthening the University of Medicine .

Title: Reps to probe investments in power sector by past govts
Summary: Reps to probe investments in power sector by past govts . Speaker Abbas Tajudeen says the parliament is determined to correct 17 years of failures in Nigeria’s electricity sector . He declared that the House will thoroughly investigate all government investments made since the commencement of the power sector .

Title: SUBEBs celebrate Jolly Phonics as Nigeria’s most successful literacy project
Summary: State Universal Basic Education Boards hail Jolly Phonics Project for its exceptional impact on early-grade literacy . SUBEBs across Kano, Lagos, Kaduna, Adamawa and Zamfara hail the project as one of the most successful education interventions ever .

Title: High court convicts ISWAP leader as DSS pursues multiple terrorism cases
Summary: Federal High Court convicts one of the leaders of the Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP), Ismaila, also known as Mai Tangaran, on terrorism charges . DSS pursues multiple terrorism cases .

Title: Latest attacks in Kwara, Kebbi, other places shocking, says Afenifere
Summary: Latest attacks in Kwara, Kebbi, other places shocking, says Afenifere . The pan-Yoruba socio-political organisation expressed shock over the attack on Christ Apostolic Church (CAC) and the killing of rice farmers in Bokungi .

Title: DSS files terrorism charges against seven suspects linked to separatist network
Summary: Department of State Services (DSS) files terrorism charges against seven individuals . Seven individuals accused of involvement in a coordinated network operating across parts of the country .

Title: UK to make legal migrants wait longer for settled status
Summary: UK to make legal migrants wait longer for settled status . Migrants who had claimed benefits for less than 12 months would have to wait 15 years . Some low-qualified workers who arrived on health and social care visas after the UK's exit from the EU would have had to wait longer .

Title: Grant Kanu pardon now, Okorie urges Tinubu
Summary: Chief Chekwas Okorie has called for political pardon for convicted Leader of the Indigenous People of Biafra,Mazi Nnamdi Kanu . Founder of the All Progressives Grand Alliance, APGA, and Convener/ National Chairman, Igbo Agenda Dialogue, IAD, Chief Okorie, urges Tinub

Title: Nnamdi Kanu to appeal life imprisonment judgment
Summary: Justice James Omotosho on Thursday convicted Kanu on all seven terrorism-related charges filed by the Federal Government . Kanu to appeal life imprisonment judgment .

Title: Onoh criticizes Kanu’s conviction, highlights double standard in de-radicalisation of Northern terrorists
Summary: Former Southeast spokesperson to President Bola Ahmed Tinubu, Denge Josef Onoh, has condemned the conviction of Mazi Nnamdi Kanu . Onoh says the move reflects a dangerous double standard in de-radicalising suspected terrorists in northern Nigeria .

Title: EFCC dismisses claims of targeting only internet fraudsters
Summary: The Economic and Financial Crimes Commission has dismissed public claims that its focus is solely on hunting internet fraudsters in Nigeria . Head of Media and Publicity, Dele Oyewale, described the claim as a “stubborn perception,” while clarifying that the agency’s work is broad-based and not limited to

Title: International delegation visits Borno to support displaced communities
Summary: A high-level delegation of international partners visited Borno State to meet communities affected by conflict and discuss long-term solutions to displacement . The visit focused on strengthening cooperation with the state government to achieve safe and sustainable pathways for displaced people to rebuild their lives across the North-East . Delegates included the Head of Development Cooperation at the British

Title: Permanent secretary appointments now strictly on merit in Edo — Deputy gov
Summary: Edo State Deputy Governor, Dennis Idahosa, has said that the appointment of permanent secretaries in the state civil service will now be based on merit . The deputy governor further noted that the era of appointing non-career civil servants as permanent secretaries was over . He said the Senator Monday Okpebholo-led administration was

Title: Decentralise NYSC for security training, Ondo private varsity VC urges FG
Summary: Prof. Samuel Obeka has called on the Federal Government to decentralise the National Youth Service Corps scheme . He said it was high time Nigerians were licensed to carry arms to defend themselves . The don, who is also a clergyman in the Methodist Church of Nigeria, made the call on Thursday .

Title: You cannot overturn Daniel’s suspension, Ogun APC tells NWC
Summary: The All Progressives Congress in Ward 4, Sabo, Sagamu, insisted that the indefinite suspension of Senator Gbenga Daniel remains in full force . The party also argued that the National Working Committee lacks the authority to overturn the suspension, which was imposed by the ward executives in accordance with the party’s constitution .
